Posts.Content: Yes. All you can do is to nap. Your bloodwork will indicate if you are low on any levels that might cause the fatigue, but usually it is the result of the treatment.
Posts.Title: Kadcyla

Posts.Content: After 14 months on X, my feet are the worst. But I found that slathering my hands and feet with Aquaphor at night, and bags on my feet (I did just order silicone socks) and plastic food service gloves on my hands....Keep them from cracking as badly. The advice to wear white socks and white cotton gloves at night doesn't make sense since they absorb the ointment. I am on 2,000 a day, one week on and one week off as a 17+ year survivor of Stage 4 MBC de novo and currently NED.
Posts.Title: How to cope with side effects of Xeloda

Posts.Content: Donna- 17 year survivor of Stage 4 MBC de novo. Originally liver mets. Recurrence in 2011 with chest node mets. Now on Xeloda and Hercpetin. Started out ER+. PR-, Her 2 +++. Foundation One testing showed that my chest node mets were BRCA2+ Somatic. I would never touch any non-FDA approved supplements since they can negate the efficacy of my chemos. So can CBD oil, depending on the type of BC one has. Also no alcohol for me. Edited March 7, 2019 at 2:55 pm
Posts.Title: Stage 4 long survival

Posts.Content: I am a 17+ year survivor of Stage 4 MBC de novo. Depending on what chemo I am on, my diet varies. When I have nausea, I need to eat carbs to settle my stomach. While I try to eat a healthy diet, it just isn't always possible. And seriously, diets aren't going to really affect the cancer...chemo is what helps. I don't drink alcohol, take any non-FDA approved supplements (since they can negate the effects of chemo), and don't do CBD or THC. Others disagree, but I credit my longevity to my choices. As far as exercise, I do what I can, but now that I am on Xeloda with sore hands and feet, most exercise is out of the question for me.
Posts.Title: Question for MBC 5+ years

Posts.Content: I have been on Xeloda for 14 months. I use Aquaphor all of the time. Had tried Ammonium Lactate, Clobetasol and Urea 40% as prescribed by my onc. But they all dried out my feet and I had a lot of raw areas. Instead of wearing white socks and gloves at night over the Aquaphor, I now use bags on my feet- LOL. But I did order silicone socks from eBay. And I wear plastic food service gloves at night. Because, obviously, the cotton socks and gloves just absorb the ointment. I use Udderly Smooth several times a day on my hands. I am only on 2,000 a day, one week on, one week off, so my nausea isn't bad at all. Take the pills a half hour after a high protein meal or snack. I have used Zofran, but also like OTC Emetrol for nausea.
Posts.Title: How do you handle side effects from Xeloda?

Posts.Content: Aberges- My specialty pharmacist told me to take the pills a half hour after a high protein meal for the best efficacy of X. And I do agree with beatez….carbs are my friend for nausea. I was on Kadcyla for almost 4 years and lived on buttered noodles and mashed potatoes. LOL to cookies! Me too!
Posts.Title: How do you handle side effects from Xeloda?

Posts.Content: BS to that! I am a 17 year survivor of Stage 4 MBC de novo and currently NED.
Posts.Title: Stage 4 long survival

Posts.Content: mbcbone- No, I have not. But the newer chemos, treatments and testing are great! There is so much hope for all of us. My large chest node mets were obliterated in only 8 days with a clinical trial of Poziotinib!! That is why I am now NED. I had bad SE's, so was taken off early. But I hope that they keep researching it.
Posts.Title: Stage 4 long survival

Posts.Content: Very true, since I have been on and off Herceptin for 12 years. I am currently on Xeloda with Herceptin.
Posts.Title: Stage 4 long survival

Posts.Content: The weirdest thing for me, is that exercises really hurt my back. I have done Pilates for years and years, and about 4 years ago, I had the most excruciating pains in my back, to the extent that sometimes I couldn't move for an hour. No doctors could figure out the cause. Finally, after I broke my femur and shoulder in a fall (unrelated to my back pain), lying flat on my back in a nursing home for a month, the back pain went away. About a year ago, I started to exercise again, but only stretches and touching my toes, and the pains started again. Turns out that exercising hurts my back!!! So now I am doing very mild (old-lady type) exercising. Geesh.
Posts.Title: Question for MBC 5+ years
